description: The Static Analysis Engine subsystem is a critical part of the Code Analysis and Documentation Generation Tool, responsible for deeply analyzing the codebase to build internal representations and gather code intelligence. It acts as the primary data source for subsequent AI interpretation. Its primary role is to transform raw source code into structured analytical data.

components.name: LSP Client Orchestration
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of Language Server Protocol (LSP) connections, dispatches requests, processes responses, and orchestrates file analysis. It identifies the project's programming language to instantiate and manage the appropriate language-specific LSP client.

components.name: Language-Specific LSP Clients
components.description: Provides specialized Language Server Protocol (LSP) interactions for different programming languages, such as Java, TypeScript, and JavaScript. These clients handle language-specific communication, project bootstrapping, and ensure proper configuration for accurate analysis.

components.name: Project Configuration Scanners
components.description: Scans project configurations (e.g., Java's pom.xml, build.gradle) to detect and analyze build and dependency structures. This provides crucial context and metadata necessary for accurate language-specific code analysis.

components.name: Code Graphing and Filtering
components.description: Responsible for constructing, storing, and abstracting the control flow graph (CFG) and call graph based on code intelligence gathered from LSP clients. It also manages and applies ignore patterns (from .gitignore and .codeboardingignore) to filter out irrelevant files and directories from the static analysis process.
